chess

Class Knight

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.ChessPiece
      • chess.Knight

  • public class Knight
extends ChessPiece
    This is a Knight class which represents the Knight from the Chess game. SubClass of ChessPiece. The instance of a Knight class has the ability to move to a square that is two squares away horizontally and one square vertically, or two squares vertically and one square horizontally while jumping over the other pieces if any resides on the way to the new coordinates. If the new legal coordinates contains an instance of the opposite color, the Knight instance takes it out at the completion of the its movement to the new position.
    Author:
    Imran Syed.

        Parameters:

        x - This is the Vertical coordinate in 2D array.
        y - This is the Horizontal coordinate in 2D arrays.

    • Method Detail

      • check

        public boolean check(ChessPiece[][] board)
        Abstract method from SuperClass ChessPiece. It is called by the MovePiece Method to determine weather this instance threatens the King of the opposite color after it has moved to its new coordinates, and notifies the caller appropriately. It checks all possible Knight moves satisfying the out of bound restriction for 2D arrays.
        Specified by:
        check in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        board - This is the actual board which helps determine weather this instance threatens the King of the opposite color.
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if it does threaten the opposite color of king else returns false.

      • move

        public boolean move(ChessPiece[][] board,
                    int x,
                    int y)
        This is abstract method from ChessPiece SuperClass. It is called by the movePiece method to determine weather the new coordinates is appropriate to replace this instance to the new coordinates. It checks weather the new coordinates requires the piece to move two squares up and right or left, two squares down and right or left, two squares left and up or down , or two squares right and up or down, and notifies the caller appropriately.
        Specified by:
        move in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        board - this is the actual board that helps determine the existence of other pieces to the target(x,y) position.
        x - this is Vertical coordinate for the new target.
        y - this the Horizontal coordinate for the new target.
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if the new coordinates are legal or else returns false.
